turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Man, you really bummed me out. That's a terrible story.  Nigger, you crying?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Hell, no! I just got something in my eye.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What do you think about that?

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: I think that old man lost his marbles about a hundred years ago. Come on, let's get this over with.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Why do I get the feeling when you say some time, you mean some time.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: I was already here a good many years when they came in in 1932.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: 1932? That's like, that's like...

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Sixty-five years ago. They always said the farm couldn't hold 'em forever. Looks like you're finally free, boys.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Ray's special recipe. He always had exacting standards where the hooch was concerned.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: What were they, bootleggers?

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Old man Wilkins' never came out of that bathroom. Died right there on the crapper.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Just like Elvis.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Of course nobody believed Ray and Claude.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: It's alright for a man to cry once in awhile. Just don't make a habit of it.

turns.speaker: LEON
turns.text: Hey, Willie, what was Claude's plan, anyway?

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Nothing to it, really. Claude figured they could steal a couple of bodies from the morgue. They got a couple of crackers working there don't know their asses from their elbows. Then they was gonna set fire to the infirmary and make it look like those bodies was them that got stuck inside. Claude figured during the commotion, it wouldn't be too hard to slip onto one of the fire trucks and hang tight until it rolled right on out of here in the morning.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Mama?

turns.speaker: MAMA GIBSON
turns.text: Rayford!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What are you doing here, mama?

turns.speaker: MAMA GIBSON
turns.text: I heard some things so I went to see Spanky Johnson. He told me what happened and gave me some money to get down here. What happened to your face?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Don't worry about that. Hey, fellas, this here is my mama. These are some of my friends. That's Willie, there's Poker Face, Radio, Cookie, Goldmouth, Biscuit, Jangle Leg.

turns.speaker: MAMA GIBSON
turns.text: Rayford, I wanted so much more for you than this.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Don't cry, mama. This place ain't so bad as it looks. Sure, we work hard, but there's plenty fresh air and sunshine... And you know something else, I've taken to going to church regular. They got services every Sunday right there in the mess hall.

turns.speaker: MAMA GIBSON
turns.text: Don't you lie to me, Rayford.  You still have your daddy's watch?  Well, this is all I can give you. I wish it was more.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I can't take that, mama.

turns.speaker: MAMA GIBSON
turns.text: Don't argue with me. You need it more than I do. I know how a little money can help in a place like this.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I can't believe this. I always said I'd never end up like this. I thought I'd make something of myself, do something with my life. You know, be successful. Have a big house, a family. Now I'm gonna end up just like daddy.

turns.speaker: MAMA GIBSON
turns.text: Don't say that, Rayford. Don't ever say that. He gave up hope. That's where you gotta be different.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: They gave me life, mama.

turns.speaker: MAMA GIBSON
turns.text: I gave you life. And they can't take it away from you. Remember that. You'll get outta here someday. I believe that. You gotta believe it, too.

turns.speaker: NURSE HUMPHRIES
turns.text: Is everyone here?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Hey, where's Claude? I don't see Claude!

turns.speaker: NURSE HUMPHRIES
turns.text: Stay calm, Ray. We'll find him. Claude! Has anyone seen Claude?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: He must still be in there.

turns.speaker: NURSE HUMPHRIES
turns.text: Wait for the firemen!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: It'll be too late.

turns.speaker: NURSE HUMPHRIES
turns.text: You can't go in there, Ray! You'll never make it!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I'm going in for him. He'd do the same for me.

turns.speaker: WILKINS
turns.text: Lemonade?

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: I prefer bourbon.

turns.speaker: WILKINS
turns.text: I'm sorry, I don't keep any liquor in the house.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Well, fortunately, I carry my own.

turns.speaker: WILKINS
turns.text: Hunting's been pretty good on the farm the last few years. It's one of the perks of the job. If you're interested, tomorrow I could show you some of my favorite spots.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: You don't have to twist my arm.  Say now, that gumbo has quite a kick.

turns.speaker: WILKINS
turns.text: Thank you, Claude. That'll be all for tonight.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: If you don't mind my saying, you seem mighty familiar with your house boy.

turns.speaker: WILKINS
turns.text: I believe in treating the convicts with respect, if that's what you mean.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Respect? Well, isn't that progressive.

turns.speaker: WILKINS
turns.text: If somebody deserves respect, Mr. Pike, they receive it from me, convict or no convict.

turns.speaker: WILKINS
turns.text: What's going on here?

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: I'm afraid I'm gonna have to teach this uppity nigger a lesson in manners.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: He's crazy. Don't listen to him, Wilkins.

turns.speaker: WILKINS
turns.text: Do you realize what your saying, Gibson?

turns.speaker: WILKINS
turns.text: Is there any truth to what he's saying, Pike?

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: What difference does it make? Natchez was better off without Winston Hancock! Who cares if a couple of no- account bootleggers went to jail for his killing? At least the state of Mississippi got 40 years of cheap labor out of the deal!

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Besides, why bother with bootlegging when we got us a clear cut case of murder?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Excuse me, sheriff. As we explained to your associate here, there's been a mistake. We didn't kill anybody. Now, as for the bootlegging, we happen to work for a very important man in New York.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Mr. Johnson is very well connected. If you were to let us go, I guarantee he would show you his appreciation, if you know what I mean.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Are you offering me a bribe?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I'm just trying to pay the toll on the road to justice.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: You may be able to buy your way out of trouble up in New York City, but down here we take murder seriously.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Yeah, it's getting late. I could sure use a bath.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: That's a real nice watch you got there, sir. Fancy old thing even plays a little tune.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Yeah, it's special. They don't make 'em like this anymore.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Sure don't. Mind if I ask where you got it?

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Why, my wife gave it to me on our anniversary some years back.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Must have been some time ago. Maybe forty years?

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Something like that, yes.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: She give you that scar, too?

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: I oughta shoot you for that comment, boy.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Like you shot Winston Hancock?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I'm gonna work this man's brains out the back of his head.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Shoot him, Wilkins!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: That watch was the only thing my daddy ever gave me. It meant the world to me.

turns.speaker: PIKE
turns.text: Goddamn it, Wilkins, would you please just shoot the nigger!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: He shoots me, I swear I'll take you with me! I just want to hear you say it.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Apparently, your sister died.

turns.speaker: POKER FACE
turns.text: Jenny?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: No, it says Marleen here.

turns.speaker: POKER FACE
turns.text: Appreciate it.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Anybody else need anything read?

turns.speaker: POKER FACE
turns.text: Hey, Ray, Goldmouth don't believe me. Ain't it so they got trains up in New York City that run under the streets?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: They're called subways. A nickel will take you from one end of Manhattan to the other. Helluva ride, too.

turns.speaker: POKER FACE
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Satchmo.

turns.speaker: RADIO
turns.text: Couple years back, Cookie made it clear to Greenville.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Greenville, that the nearest town?

turns.speaker: RADIO
turns.text: Hey, Ray, you ever been to the Cotton Club?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Sure I've been to the Cotton Club. It's pretty sweet. But it don't hold a candle to the Boom Boom Room. That's where the real action is.

turns.speaker: RADIO
turns.text: Hey, Ray, what's the name of that nightclub of yours?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You mean the Boom-Boom Room?

turns.speaker: RADIO
turns.text: That's it. The Boom-Boom Room. Sure would like to see that place when you get it up and running.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You should have come by last night, Radio. You woulda had yourself some fun.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What's your name?

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Me? Willie Long.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What are you in for, Willie?

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: That's a long story...

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Goldmouth? They say he was born out back behind the shithouse. That's what they say.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You all been here a long time. Doesn't anybody ever escape from this place?

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: They run but they never get too far.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: What's the Boom Boom Room?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: That's my joint. The swinginest nightclub in town.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Last night? What are you talking about, Ray?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I'm talking about old Satchmo nearly blew the roof off the joint.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Alright Willie, I think I got everything. I'll talk to Dillard, see if I can get up to the infirmary and check up on you. Make sure they're changing your diapers regular.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: They'll be sending you up there soon enough. And not just for a visit, neither.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I slipped in a couple of bottles of my latest batch. Help wash down all them pills they'll be giving you.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: How you doing? We're looking for Slim.

turns.speaker: SLIM
turns.text: You found him.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Man, that music is hot. What goes on down there, Slim?

turns.speaker: SLIM
turns.text: That's Natchez-under-the-Hill.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Blacks welcome there?

turns.speaker: SLIM
turns.text: Green's the only color that matters under the hill. They got gambling, girls. You oughta check it out.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Maybe we will. Nice meeting you.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You don't have to drown that fella, Spanky. You already scared him half to death. He didn't know who he was fucking with.

turns.speaker: SPANKY
turns.text: But you do. What does that say about you, Ray? What does that say about me? I've given you a lot of leeway over the years on account of your father. But he didn't last long enough to teach you the meaning of the word respect so I guess I'm gonna have to school you myself.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Come on, Spank, I'm just trying to get by here. You remember how it was when you were starting out.

turns.speaker: SPANKY
turns.text: What's that, some of your bathtub brew?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Puerto Rican rum. See for yourself.

turns.speaker: SPANKY
turns.text: Where'd you get this?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Comes up the Mississippi. I can get more. A lot more. I was thinking about going into business for myself, but under the circumstances, I'd be willing to take on a partner.

turns.speaker: SPANKY
turns.text: I'm interested. Keep talking.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: All I need is the front money and a truck. I could be back in two, three days tops if I had somebody to share the driving.

turns.speaker: SPANKY
turns.text: If you fuck me on this one, I'll spare no expense.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Understood.

turns.speaker: SPANKY
turns.text: Alright, Ray, you've got a deal. Pick your man and get going.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I'll take the little choirboy, if you don't mind.

turns.speaker: SPANKY
turns.text: If I was you, I'd want somebody who can handle himself in a tight spot.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I just want somebody who won't put a bullet in my back once the truck is full.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: ADRIAN!

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: You shouldn't have come here.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Please, get out of my mind!

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Adrian, you gotta come back to Hell. Dad's sick.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: He's sick?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Yeah, he needs souls to live. When you guys left, you broke the gates. We gotta get the gates burning again before he dies.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: He should have thought of that before he denied me my birthright.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Well maybe you should go back and talk it over with him.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: How about this? I stay here enjoying my Schnapps and you go back.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Of course I can. Drink or she dies.  Unlike you, she won't come back from where she's going.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Let her go.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: I hear a train coming. Drink.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Welcome to the party. It's so nice to see all of you here.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Hey, that's Dad's throne! How did Adrian get that? Is Dad okay?

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Little Nicky.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Adrian, I'm asking you nicely, in the name of all that is good: release my friends and get in the flask.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Is this a joke?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: No. It's the inner light. And with it we can defeat anything you've got.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Now will you get in the flask?

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Absolutely not.

turns.speaker: CASSIUS
turns.text: I knew it. He's finally retiring.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: I've been waiting on this day for ten thousand years.

turns.speaker: CASSIUS
turns.text: You work your ass off for ten thousand years, hurting people, helping others hurt people, then you get a decision like that.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: And he's dead serious.

turns.speaker: CASSIUS
turns.text: It's just such a slap in the face.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Um, excuse me, we're having a private conversation here.

turns.speaker: CASSIUS
turns.text: Yeah, get out of here! Beat it!

turns.speaker: CASSIUS
turns.text: That's what I thought!

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Could you concentrate for five seconds?

turns.speaker: CASSIUS
turns.text: I am concentrating. Where can we rule?

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: What do you think about... Earth?

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: We could create our own hell there.

turns.speaker: CASSIUS
turns.text: You saying we go up there and kill everyone?

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Eventually, Cassius. But first we corrupt as many as we can so that when we do destroy them...

turns.speaker: CASSIUS
turns.text: ...their damned souls will be ours.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: It's our time, brother.

turns.speaker: CASSIUS
turns.text: "Let the sin begins" -- that was a good one.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Well, we must get people sinning if we want to fill up our New Hell. How are things going down at City Hall?

turns.speaker: CASSIUS
turns.text: I lowered the drinking age to ten.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Brilliant. This is so much fun. I never want it to end.

turns.speaker: CASSIUS
turns.text: Why should it end? Who's gonna stop us?

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Hello, Cassius.

turns.speaker: CASSIUS
turns.text: All right. Let me out.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: You know, New Hell really only needs one new Satan.

turns.speaker: CASSIUS
turns.text: You mother...

turns.speaker: CASSIUS
turns.text: Thank you, Nicky. Cause now I'm gonna bust Adrian's head wide open.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: I was going to let you out, eventually, Cassius. I swear.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: CASSIUS
turns.text: Don't do it!

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Ta-da. So what time is my brother expected back?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Noon...

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: But what about the cash? Can we keep it or what?

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Sure, why not?

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: It is awfully hot down here. How do you manage to stay so cool?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Weed lowers the body temperature.  I read that... in, uh... er, science magazine.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: And give you a good buzz.

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Or maybe it will trap me inside for all eternity.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Uh. No it won't?

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Oh, Nicky, I've missed you. Come on out and say hello...

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Urr... uggg... errr...

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: I'm calling you out, brother...

turns.speaker: ADRIAN
turns.text: Keep it up and I just might make you my Queen for a night or two.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You want a queen? Got one right here.

turns.speaker: ANGEL
turns.text: Oh. My. God. I can't believe you're here. Welcome. Can I just tell you, I am so excited right now.

turns.speaker: CHRISTA
turns.text: So excited.

turns.speaker: CHRISTA
turns.text: I remember that night, you had like four daiquiris.

turns.speaker: ANGEL
turns.text: Try four and a half. At first I totally didn't like him.

turns.speaker: ANGEL
turns.text: I'll call her later.

turns.speaker: CHRISTA
turns.text: You know, we saw you save your girlfriend's life.

turns.speaker: ANGEL
turns.text: All these good people have totally been led astray.

turns.speaker: CHRISTA
turns.text: Show him Central Park.

turns.speaker: CHRISTA
turns.text: She goes to Parson's, right?

turns.speaker: ANGEL
turns.text: I would totally love to go there. But I hear it's really hard to get in.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: The home of eternal damnation, house of Hades, H.E. double toothpicks...

turns.speaker: ANGEL
turns.text: Maybe try the opposite of that.

turns.speaker: ANGEL
turns.text: Okay, can I just ask you something? What do you know about your mom?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: My brothers told me my mother was a mountain goat. Which would explain my chronic halitosis.

turns.speaker: ANGEL
turns.text: A mountain goat? That's really sweet.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: My mom wasn't a goat?

turns.speaker: ANGEL
turns.text: Try an angel.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: An angel?

turns.speaker: ANGEL
turns.text: Unh-huh. Which would make you half angel.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Wow. What... what did she look like?

turns.speaker: ANGEL
turns.text: Well, she was about six-three, only spoke Portuguese and had really long grey hair.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: How come you're not older?

turns.speaker: ANGEL
turns.text: Angels don't get any older, son.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Where did you meet my father?

turns.speaker: ANGEL
turns.text: It was a long time ago, at some Heaven and Hell mixer.

turns.speaker: ANGEL
turns.text: Hello... yes, he's here with me now... I don't know if he's hot, he's my son, you perv! I'll call you back...  Oh my God, I will call you back, goodbye.  That was my friend, Michelle, she says "hi."

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Well tell her I said "hi" back.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: How did you see me?

turns.speaker: ANGEL
turns.text: We can see what's going on anywhere on Earth. Look.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Valerie's crying!

turns.speaker: ANGEL
turns.text: She's so nice.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I gotta help her. I gotta help Dad. I gotta help everybody.

turns.speaker: ANGEL
turns.text: Yeah, you do...

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: But how can I win? Adrian is stronger and smarter than me.

turns.speaker: ANGEL
turns.text: Stronger, yes. Smarter, definitely. But you have something he doesn't have.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: A speech impediment?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: ANGEL
turns.text: I'm not a hundred percent on that. God said when the time comes, you'll know what to do.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Well, nice meeting you, Jenna, Christa.  Would it be okay if I called you Mommy?

turns.speaker: ANGEL
turns.text: It would be so okay.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Well, Mommy, get me to the big apple cause I'm gonna rock that town like a hurricane.

turns.speaker: ANGEL
turns.text: You're already there...

turns.speaker: TODD
turns.text: What's Nicky doing down there?

turns.speaker: BEEFY
turns.text: Trying to capture his brother in a flask and preserve the balance of good and evil on Earth.

turns.speaker: TODD
turns.text: Did you just talk?

turns.speaker: BEEFY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: TODD
turns.text: Where is he? He's late.

turns.speaker: BEEFY
turns.text: He'll be here. Just keep your cool, kid.

turns.speaker: TODD
turns.text: They castrated him. He can't shoot arrows, he can't piss smoke.

turns.speaker: BEEFY
turns.text: I can't screw.  I can't screw.

turns.speaker: TODD
turns.text: Oh my God, he just opened his mouth and swallowed that spit.

turns.speaker: BEEFY
turns.text: That turn you on there, RuPaul?

turns.speaker: BEEFY
turns.text: My name's Beefy. I'm an old friend of your father's. He's asked me to help you out.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I just need to find my brothers and be on my way, Beefy.

turns.speaker: BEEFY
turns.text: It's not gonna be easy. Your brothers can possess people. So they probably won't look like themselves. You have to be suspicious of everyone.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Okay, "bro," this jig is up...  Just get in the bottle. Just slide right on in there.

turns.speaker: BEEFY
turns.text: It's not me, moron.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Oh. Sorry.

turns.speaker: BEEFY
turns.text: Makin' friends already.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: It's freezing up here, Beefy.

turns.speaker: BEEFY
turns.text: You're on Earth now, kid. Gonna have the same physical needs and limitations a human has. We'll stop by K-mart. Get you some warm clothes.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I also have this odd pain in my mid section. Kind of a hollow feeling...

turns.speaker: BEEFY
turns.text: That pain is hunger.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: So far, so good. Now what?

turns.speaker: BEEFY
turns.text: Put it in your mouth.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Hey... Popeye's chicken is ass kickin'!

turns.speaker: BEEFY
turns.text: It sure is. Now eat it up. You're gonna need your energy.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: I got energy up the ying-ying. Let's get cracking!

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: From now on. I'm just going to avoid all moving metal objects.

turns.speaker: BEEFY
turns.text: Great. Now your father gave me some deposit money for a nice pad on the Upper East Side. But I misplaced it.

turns.speaker: BEEFY
turns.text: You'll be alright. Go on. Big day tomorrow. Don't forget to do that sleep thing I told you about.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Got ya.  Is it okay if I do the sleep thing?

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: This is intense! And it happens every day? Sometimes twice? I gotta tip my hat to you people!

turns.speaker: BEEFY
turns.text: Look, it's okay for me to shit the street. But you gotta use a toilet.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Okay, just point me in the right direction next time.

turns.speaker: BEEFY
turns.text: Come on, there's like ten million people in this city and the clock is ticking.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: Well, let's rock and roll.

turns.speaker: NICKY
turns.text: All that running and chasing is making the sleep thing want to come early.

turns.speaker: BEEFY
turns.text: I think we have to work on narrowing down our list of suspects. Now I'm going to go check in with some of my contacts uptown.
